isis.stitle: TSI 06-08-04 - Low Current Circuit Oxidation in International® 1000, 3000, 4000 HPV, 5000i, 7000 HPV, 8000 HPV, 9000i Models

subjectgroup.subject: Low Current Circuit Oxidation in International® 1000, 3000, 4000 HPV, 5000i, 7000 HPV, 8000 HPV, 9000i Models

geninfo.para: Low current circuits, data link, sensor circuits, analog and digital circuits are more susceptible to oxidation. The oxidation forms a layer between the mating terminals that over time could result in an intermittent connection or high resistance in the circuit. Should you encounter this condition, following the procedure outlined will protect connector terminals and receptacles from oxidation and alleviate most intermittent conditions that can occur at connection interfaces.

entry.para: Certified Labs Electra Coat Rubberized Coating

svcproc.title: Service procedure

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

Batteries expel explosive gases. Keep sparks, flames. burning cigarettes, or other ignition sources away at all times. Always wear safety glasses and a face shield when working near batteries to prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Locate and clean/degrease low current circuit connectors.
Disconnect low current circuit connectors and inspect for corrosion. Clean connector terminals with Ecoline Contact Cleaner, Part Number 2591041C1 (Figure 1).

svcproc.para: NOTE: It is safe to use Ecoline Contact Cleaner on electrical connector body plastics, rubber products, and surface plating such as tin or gold. More information on Ecoline Contact Cleaner can be found at www.techspray.com.

step1.para: Inspect the cleaned connector and repair/replace connector terminals with signs of corrosion as needed.
After the connector terminals are fully dry, apply RidOx Contact Protector/Enhancer, Part Number 2591044C1 (Figure 1).

svcproc.para: NOTE: RidOx Contact Protector/Enhancer will seal, protect, improve conductivity of the terminal, prevent oxidation, prevent fretting and fretting corrosion, and will not migrate.
NOTE: Also available for certain situations is RidOx Contact Protector/Enhancer Pen, Part Number 2591045C1 (Figure 2).

step1.para: Reassemble the connector, making sure all plug seals are in place in the unused connector holes and connector wires are not pulled to the side due to cable tie strap being too tight or a cable tie strap too close to the connector. Wipe off any external residual material.
Optional but recommended: Hermetically seal the connector body with Certified Labs Electra Coat Rubberized Coating, Part Number 2591046C1.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Certified Labs Electra Coat Rubberized Coating dries clear, has good abrasion resistance, stays flexible, and has excellent adhesion to clean surfaces. For more information go to www.certifiedlabs.com.

step1.para: Reconnect the negative battery cable and check for proper operation.

note.para: This procedure and these products also work well on high current connectors.
